intro: Ervatamia montensis, commonly known as the mountain ervatamia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its aromatic foliage and unique morphology make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
